events.name: FCL Lunch Talk: Transforming Big Data into Big Decisions
events.description:
FCL Lunch Talk: Transforming Big Data into Big Decisions
Every day, as you browse the Internet and carry your mobile phone, you create and share data about yourself. This data of the people and by the people is the most important economic resource of the twenty-first century, as important as oil. And as with oil, the real value comes from refining that raw material – whether at giant multinationals like Google, Facebook, and Amazon or smaller outfits developing techniques to identify shopping habits, job productivity, or wellbeing from our digital traces.
The talk will show that it's misguided to fight for a naive conception of privacy or anonymity; that would mean giving up many of the products and services you've come to depend on. Instead, you must take an active role in extracting value from your data, especially as more data comes from social networks and sensors. To ensure your data is being used for you and not against you, you must demand a seat at the controls of the data refineries.
The speaker argues that every refinery should provide you with a data "hygiene" dashboard -- including measures of expected risk and return on data shared. He outlines five tools that reward data creators with more decision-making power: the right to export data, the right to amend data, the right to blur data, the ability to "dial" personalization up and down, and the ability to see how changing inputs affects outputs. 
Speaker: Andreas Weigend
weigend.com/ofa 
Andreas Weigend researches the future of big data, social-mobile technologies, and consumer behavior. He studies people and the data they create. He advises companies that want to embrace the new reality of social data. Together, they design interactive platforms and real-time systems that empower them and their customers to make better decisions. As Amazon's chief scientist, he helped create the firm's data strategy and customer-centric culture. Andreas Weigend teaches at Stanford University and UC Berkeley, where he directs the Social Data Lab, and speaks at corporate events and top conferences around the globe. He received his Ph.D. in Physics from Stanford University after studying in Germany and Cambridge, UK. He lives in San Francisco and Shanghai.
events.location: Value Lab Asia, Singapore-ETH Centre, #06-01, CREATE Tower, 1 Create Way, Singapore 138602

events.name: Create Video On-The-Go with iMovie iOS Workshop
events.description:
Love shooting videos while traveling? Wish to create a video that catches people's eyes? Want to learn how you can fully utilise the FREE iMovie app on your iPad or iPhone to edit your footages and tell great stories on the go? Well, this workshop is for you!




Technology nowadays have changed the way how we see and do things, it gives us the flexibility to create and express ourselves almost without boundaries in many different ways. In this case, iMovie.

Turn your videos into movie magic.
With iMovie you can enjoy your videos like never before. It’s easy to browse your clips and create Hollywood-style trailers and stunning 4K-resolution movies. You can even start editing on iPhone or iPad, then finish on your Mac. And when you’re ready to premiere your movie on all your devices, iMovie Theater rolls out the red carpet.



Make Movies Easily. From the first scene to the last.
It’s never been easier to make movies. Just choose your clips, then add titles, music and effects. iMovie even supports 4K video for stunning cinema-quality films. And that, ladies and gentlemen, is a wrap.

What you will learn
In this workshop you will learn how to import your footage, setting up project file, familiarise editing tools, combining footages, adding text and effects, audio editing, exporting and more! So don't missed out this chance to learn this amazing application.
P/S: You are recommended to download the iMovie app on your iOS devices before attending the workshop.

See ya real soon!
events.location: Switch AEON Mall Bandar Dato’ Onn, Lot F29, First Floor, Aeon Mall Kempas, No. 3, Jalan Dato’Onn, Bandar Dato’Onn,, Johor Bahru 81100
